title: Short insert size WGS libraries preparation for assembly of the Lateolabrax maculatus genome
original description: This protocol is used to clarity the process of the short insert size WGS libraries preparation for the L. maculatus.
steps:
Genomic DNA interruption
1. The extracted DNA was sheared into fragments between 50 bp and ~800 bp in size using a Covaris E220 ultrasonicator (Covaris, Brighton, UK). Treat time 20s, Acoustic Duty Factor 25%, Peak Incident Power 500W, Cycles Per Burst 500, 24 cycles. 
20s

Fragment selection
2. Fragments between 150 bp and 250 bp or 200 to 500 bp were selected using AMPure XP beads (Agencourt, Beverly, the U.S.).
reagents

End-repair
3. Repaired using T4 DNA polymerase, (ENZYMATICS, Beverly, the U.S.) 30 min. at 20 ℃ to obtain blunt ends which were then 3’-adenlyated to create sticky ends.
reagents 
1800s 
20temperature

Add adapter
4. These DNA fragments were ligated at both ends to T-tailed adapters and amplified.

PCR amplification 
5. The temperature profile was 3 min. at 95 ℃ followed by 8 cycles of 20 sec. at 98 ℃, 15 sec. at 60 ℃, 30 sec. at 72 ℃, and more 10 min. at 72 ℃ for further elongation.

Library purification
6. AMPure XP beads (Agencourt, Beverly, the U.S.) was used to purify the PCR production.
ai_generated_description: This protocol outlines the procedure for preparing short insert size whole genome sequencing (WGS) libraries for the genome assembly of the Lateolabrax maculatus species. The process involves breaking down the genomic DNA into fragments, fragment selection, end-repair to create sticky ends, adapter ligation, PCR amplification, and purification to ultimately produce the WGS libraries.
